title: Taylor Swift joins SAS: Who Dares Wins star for Children in Need song
text:
Taylor Swift is getting in the charity spirit, and will appear with BBC Children in Need: Got It Covered to help SAS: Who Dares Wins narrator Shaun Dooley cover one of her tracks.

Nope. We’re not kidding.

Shaun, who’s also appeared on Gentleman Jack and soon, Netflix’s The Witcher, has joined a host of famous faces taking part in Got It Covered – a special album where actors will be turning popstar and covering a number of hit tracks.

But it seems that Taylor was on hand to give Shaun a boost when recording her song Never Grow Up over at Abbey Road Studios – and popped in to give him some tips.

In scenes soon to air in a documentary tracking the album’s creation, Taylor makes a surprise appearance to see how the actor is getting on with his version of the track.

Move over Robbie Williams and Tyson Fury, we have a new contender for ‘weirdest collab of 2019’…and possibly ever.

Advertisement

Advertisement

We can’t wait to see how it turns out.

Other stars taking part in the project are: Helena Bonham Carter, Jim Broadbent, Olivia Colman, Luke Evans, Suranne Jones, Adrian Lester, Himesh Patel, David Tennant and Jodie Whittaker.

All of their covers will be available soon, with proceeds of album sales going towards the worthy cause of Children In Need.

Shaun (centre in blue) is joining a number of famous including Olivia Colman, Jim Broadbent and Helena Bonham-Carter for the charity album (Picture: BBC)

The stars received vocal training from renowned coach Mark De-Lisser for the effort, to help the stars perfectly put their spin on their bespoke tracks.

As well as their own singular covers, they will also join forces for a cover of It Must Be Love by Labi Siffre.

BBC Children In Need: Got It Covered airs Wednesday 30 October, 7.30pm on BBC One.

Angelina Jolie thanks kids for getting her through 'difficult years' in wake of split Sharon Horgan gives update on Catastrophe future after shock series 4 ending Harry reveals he and William have 'good and bad days' as he addresses feud rumours

Children In Need: Got It Covered Tracklist Helena Bonham-Carter: Both Sides Now by Joni Mitchell Jim Broadbent: Blue Moon by Rogers and Hart Jodie Whittaker: Yellow by Coldplay Olivia Colman: Glory Box by Portishead Shaun Dooley: Never Grow Up by Taylor Swift Luke Evans: Smile by Charlie Chaplin Suranne Jones: Symphony by Clean Bandit Adrian Lester: I Wish by Stevie Wonder Himesh Patel: All These Things That I’ve Done by The Killers

description: Taylor Swift helped actor Shaun Dooley record a cover of her single Never Grow Up at Abbey Road Studios for Children in Need: Got It Covered.
